item.title: Ombre Brows? What It Is And How It Differs From Miroblading
item.dc:creator: lucialashandbrow
item.description:
What are Ombre Brows and the benefits?  Ombré Brows is a semi-permanent eyebrow shading technique. It uses a machine to place thin dots […]

The post Ombre Brows? What It Is And How It Differs From Miroblading first appeared on LUCIA LASH/BROW.
item.content:encoded:
What are Ombre Brows and the benefits? 

Ombré Brows is a semi-permanent eyebrow shading technique. It uses a machine to place thin dots of pigment into the skin, creating a soft-shaded brow pencil look. It is the best option for sensitive or oily skin, gives the appearance of fuller and more define brows, and it requires fewer touch-up appointments! 




How are Ombre Brows different from Microblading? 

The most significant difference between microblading and ombre brows is how the pigment is added to the skin. Microblading is making short hair-like strokes and ombre brows are small fine dots that vary in concentration while giving the look of a powdered brow. 

Does Ombre Brows Hurt? 

The ombré shading technique is said to be gentler than microblading, because the needle isn’t going as deep into the skin. Still, the process starts with topical numbing. At Lucia Lash/Brow New York, Philadelphia, Stamford, and Park Slope, we will then draw on your brow so that you can see the exact placement of the shading, before using a small machine to start applying the pigment. The process can still be uncomfortable, but it can be easier to get the perfect placement of your brows. 



A Quick Recap

  • Ombre Brows are great for those with Oily Skin 
  • Ombre Brows are great for those with Sensitive Skin 
  • The application is a lot more gentle than microblading, which will cause it to feel a lot more comfortable. 
  • Ombre Brows give the brows a soft-shaded brow pencil look. 

Are Ombre Brows something you would consider trying ?

item.title: Microblading vs Nanoblading
item.dc:creator: lucialashandbrow
item.description:
Microblading Microblading is a permanent makeup treatment for eyebrows done by depositing pigments between eyebrow hairs in thin strokes. At […]

The post Microblading vs Nanoblading first appeared on LUCIA LASH/BROW.
item.content:encoded:
Microblading


Microblading is a permanent makeup treatment for eyebrows done by depositing pigments between eyebrow hairs in thin strokes. At Lucia Lash/Brow Philadelphia we use a special microblading tool made up of 10 to 16 fine blades of different thicknesses which are dipped into a liquid pigment solution and dragged through the epidermis. We will use the tool to make the brow arches, fuller, thicker, and symmetrical. The tool is made up of 10-to-16 fine blades and dipped into liquid pigment solutions.


Nanoblading


Nanoblading is a more precise version of microblading. At Lucia Lash/Brow Philadelphia we use a single-needle device, the nanoneedle machine, which works like a tattoo machine but uses an extremely fine needle to inject pigments into the epidermis. The nanoneedle is flexible and as thin as hair. Some artists call it 3D nano brows because the thin strokes are indistinguishable from the natural hairs. The most common thickness is 0.18mm thick. 



What is the difference between Microblading and Nanoblading?


The main differences between microblading and nanoblading are the tools and the technique. Nanoneedles cause significantly less trauma to the skin than the microbladed tool. The flexibility and thinness of the nanoneedle prevent the pigment from going too deep into the skin. The possibility of infection and scarring is minimal.  The results are natural looking, but enhance brows, which last relatively long. 

How Long Will Microblading Last?

The results of microblading last up to 18 months and can be prolonged with touch-ups and proper aftercare. Microblading also fades significantly faster on oily skin. Avoid sunlight, exfoliation, and skincare products that contain particularly aggressive ingredients like glycolic acid. The results can be delayed with touch-ups and aftercare. 

How Long Will Nanoblading Last?

Nano brows’ results last from 2 to 2.5 years on average, depending on skin type and lifestyle. Nanoblading is better suited for oily skin and is more resilient to excess oil produced within the pores. Likewise, it is also more suitable than microblading for skin with large pores. Nanoblading  is more resistant to excess oils produced in the pores of the brows.  Nano brow’s results last between 2 and 2 years depending on the skin type or lifestyle. 

Is Microblading better than Nanoblading ? 

It all depends on the look that you’re going for! With Nanoblading, each stroke is individual and thinner than a microblading stroke, so they are better incorporated into the natural brows and at Lash/Brow Philadelphia, Park slope, or Stamford, we can modify the arch with much more precision. Nanoblading also looks more natural on people with thin eyebrow hairs, and clients with alopecia who have no brow hairs. Nanobrows are more suitable for clients with oily skin and large pores since thin strokes are more resilient. On the other hand, microbladed is the slightly cheaper option, so if you’re looking for a more enhanced look and don’t insist on perfect precision you may be the right choice. 

In Summary

When it comes to microblading and nanoblading, it all comes down to your likes and preferences. During your consultation and Lucia Lash/Brow Philadelphia, Parkslope, or Stamford, we will talk about both procedures, their differences and which one would be best for you based on skintype and lifestyle.

item.title: BROW LAMINATION IN STAMFORD CONNECTICUT
item.dc:creator: lucialashandbrow
item.description:
What is Brow Lamination? Brow Lamination is the hot new brow trend that is on everyone’s list of beauty treatments […]

The post BROW LAMINATION IN STAMFORD CONNECTICUT first appeared on LUCIA LASH/BROW.
item.content:encoded:
What is Brow Lamination?

Brow Lamination is the hot new brow trend that is on everyone’s list of beauty treatments to try! Get fuller-looking brows without having to apply any brow product every morning when doing your makeup.



Got Unruly Brows?

Sometimes it can be frustrating trying to get brows to be set in place and have all hairs lie in the same direction. Being that the brows helps with framing the eyes and shaping of the face, it is very important to have them tamed. Did you know that there is no need for much makeup if your brows are tamed? This is where Brow Lamination comes in!

How Brow Lamination Will Fix Your Brows

Brow Lamination begins with the application of a perm cream that breaks down the protein bonds in the brow hairs. This will allow the hairs to be brushed easily into a new upward position. A second solution is applied, which reforms the protein bonds into the new position, holding the eye brow in its new shape. Brow Lamination can change the direction of hair growth to create a more tamed look with a higher arch and a more desirable brow shape.


“Will The Perm Solution Damage MyBrows?”

Usually when we hear the word perm, one of the things that may come to mind is hair damage. It is one of the first things that came to our minds as well, and that is what made us create a thio-free perming solution that also has Keratin in it. This will help to keep brow hairs healthy during the brow lamination process, so that in the end you will have your goal brows without compromising the health of your brow hairs.

Ready To Try Brow Lamination?

Ok, so now after reading all that info on Brow Lamination, you fee like you may be a good candidate and you want to try? The service is available at both our New York City and Philadelphia location, as well as our new Stamford Connecticut location! Give us a call at 203-742-7786, or book online at lucialashandbrow.com! We all want perfect brows.

item.title: Brow lamination taking beauty industry by storm
item.dc:creator: lucialashandbrow
item.description:
Many people are unable to grow their eyebrows into a lush shape as sported by supermodels and actresses. The reasons […]

The post Brow lamination taking beauty industry by storm first appeared on LUCIA LASH/BROW.
item.content:encoded:
Many people are unable to grow their eyebrows into a lush shape as sported by supermodels and actresses. The reasons behind it could be over plucking them in the past, age, illness or something else. Many are also struggling with unruly eyebrows that do not hold their shape well. Sometimes people who are tired of managing their eyebrows resort to microblading. However, you can fix all these eyebrow issues with a new trendy beauty treatment loved by Hollywood stars – brow lamination. The new treatment is available on Amazon.com for more information.

Eyebrow lamination is a good alternative to microblading, but it is also perfect in combination with it. In the latter case, you should get the brow lamination treatment first and microbladed at least 2 days later. For unruly eyebrows that hold into different directions, the procedure will help shape them in the right direction, soften and smooth over the eyebrow hair, and also visually lift the eyebrow arch. You can also hide gaps and create the impression of thicker eyebrows or extend them sideways.

Before and after eyebrow lamination with Lash Super Booster products

item.title: What is Brow Lamination?
item.dc:creator: lucialashandbrow
item.content:encoded:
What is brow lamination?

Brow lamination is “a perm” for your brows as it gives them a set uniform shape for an extended period. A two-step eyebrow perming treatment that involves correcting the brow shape by setting the hairs in place using a chemical solution. Laminated brows takes your unruly or thinning brow hair and smoothen it out while also lifting the hair in a more vertical direction.

At Lucia Lash we use Thio-free products which causes a lot less damage. Traditionally, the most used ingredient in perming is thioglycolic acid (often referred to as Thio). Thio is a salt and is the reducing agent responsible for breaking the disulfide bonds in your hair. Our Thio free formula restructures internal bonds without damaging the hair cuticle. Keratin is also an ingredient that is included in our perming solution. This makes the hair more damage resistant, keeps it strong and has a retention for up to 6 weeks. At Lucia Lash/Brow we provide a detailed consultation before every brow lamination application, explaining the entire process.

 

Laminate brows is available at both our NY and Pa locations and will also be available at our future new location in Connecticut(more information on that soon!)
